definition: to lift/to raise/to raise one's head/high/high spirits/soaring/expensive

sentences.english: The famous movie stars swept in and astonished the guests.
sentences.chinese: 著名的影星昂然走了進來，使客人們大爲喫驚。

sentences.english: Some things are fun the first time you do them------ and then not so much the next.
sentences.chinese: 有些事情第一次做興致昂然，之後再做就索然無味了。

sentences.english: The statues of former navy generals stand rock-firm, silently observing Weihai's tremendous changes.
sentences.chinese: 海軍將領的雕像昂然屹立，靜觀着威海的滄桑鉅變。

sentences.english: Toward the Qin Shi, the number of people who proudly interest, flocked to forget.
sentences.chinese: 向着石琴，多少人興致昂然，絡繹不絕，流連忘返。

sentences.english: Standtall by what you know INSIDE TO BE TRUE.
sentences.chinese: 通過知曉你內在是真實的而昂然屹立。

sentences.english: The judge swept in the courtroom.
sentences.chinese: 這位法官昂然走進法庭。

sentences.english: Now get up to stand tall.
Up to the present, the ancient tea plants are still luxuriance.
sentences.chinese: 至今，古茶樹林依然蔥鬱茂密，生機昂然。

definition: head high, chest out (idiom); to keep up one's spirits/in fine mettle (of animal)
striding forward with head high (idiom); to walk with spirited and vigorous step/to strut
head high/in high spirits/to raise one's head (e.g. of neighing horse)
to sprout up/to flourish/(of war etc) to break out/rapid growth
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
